logic

Class OutputManager

  • Object
    • logic.OutputManager

  • public class OutputManager
extends Object
    This is the class that will manage formatting all the output that needs to be printed by the descriptions and action information of the game. Use its methods to make sure your output is both easier to read, and adds a small bit of personality to the Narrator descriptions.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OutputManager() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearIO()
      Clears the text currently displayed in the PanelIO of the application window, specifically, the output JTextArea, not the input JTextField.
      void clearStats()
      Clears the text currently displayed in the PanelStats output.
      void printBlankLineIO()
      Sometimes you just want to space things out a bit.
      void printBlankLineStats()
      Sometimes you just want to space things out a bit.
      void printFancyIO(String... description)
      This is meant to be used to print Narrator story inside a fancy billboard.
      void printInfoIO(String... info)
      This is meant to be used by the Game for descriptive information that does not need to be printed in a fancy billboard box, because it is not a narrative part of the story.
      void printInfoStats(String... info)
      This is meant to be used by the Game for stat information.
      void printPromptIO(String prompt)
      This is meant to be called by the InputManager for prompts.
      void setPanelIO(PanelIO outIO)
      So the text we want to print knows which PanelIO to send its descriptions.
      void setPanelStats(PanelStats outStats)
      So the text we want to print knows which PanelStats to send its statistics.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OutputManager

        public OutputManager()

    • Method Detail

      • setPanelIO

        public void setPanelIO(PanelIO outIO)
        So the text we want to print knows which PanelIO to send its descriptions. Also, so that it knows where to get user input.
        Parameters:
        outIO - A PanelIO instance for user interaction with its GUI.

      • setPanelStats

        public void setPanelStats(PanelStats outStats)
        So the text we want to print knows which PanelStats to send its statistics.
        Parameters:
        outStats - A PanelStats instance for the user to read with its GUI.

      • printFancyIO

        public void printFancyIO(String... description)
        This is meant to be used to print Narrator story inside a fancy billboard.
        Parameters:
        description - The array of string descriptions to be printed, each string on its own line and centred inside the boundary of its rectangular border. Have some empty string elements inside the array to break up reading too much text.

      • printPromptIO

        public void printPromptIO(String prompt)
        This is meant to be called by the InputManager for prompts. Makes InputManager code easier to read.
        Parameters:
        prompt - One string meant to ask the user to enter something.

      • printInfoIO

        public void printInfoIO(String... info)
        This is meant to be used by the Game for descriptive information that does not need to be printed in a fancy billboard box, because it is not a narrative part of the story. Also makes Game code easier to read. It could even help with debugging as an alternative that lets you print an array of strings to see it within the PanelIO output.
        Parameters:
        info - An array of strings to give information about current game descriptions. Make sure you are printing enough information so the user knows what is happening in the game.

      • printBlankLineIO

        public void printBlankLineIO()
        Sometimes you just want to space things out a bit. If you want different output behaviour, then you can just change this method, instead of rewriting everywhere a System.out.println() is used.

      • clearIO

        public void clearIO()
        Clears the text currently displayed in the PanelIO of the application window, specifically, the output JTextArea, not the input JTextField.

      • clearStats

        public void clearStats()
        Clears the text currently displayed in the PanelStats output.

      • printInfoStats

        public void printInfoStats(String... info)
        This is meant to be used by the Game for stat information. Also makes Game code easier to read. It could even help with debugging when you just want to print an array of strings to output.
        Parameters:
        info - An array of strings to give information about current game stats. Make sure you are printing enough information so the user knows what is the state of objects in the game (the current values of certain instance variables).

      • printBlankLineStats

        public void printBlankLineStats()
        Sometimes you just want to space things out a bit. If you want different output behaviour, then you can just change this method, instead of rewriting everywhere a System.out.println() is used.
